017package org.microbean.type;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.Type;
020
021import java.util.AbstractSet;
022import java.util.Collection;
023import java.util.Collections;
024import java.util.Iterator;
025import java.util.Set;
026import java.util.SortedSet;
027import java.util.Spliterator;
028import java.util.TreeSet;
029
030/**
031 * An {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable}
032 * {@link AbstractSet} of {@link Type}s with additional convenient
033 * functionality.
034 *
035 * <p>{@linkplain #iterator() Iteration} over any {@link TypeSet}
036 * instance is guaranteed to be in some deterministic but otherwise
037 * unspecified order.  The order is subject to change between versions
038 * of this class.</p>
039 *
040 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
041 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
042 */
043public class TypeSet extends AbstractSet<Type> {
044
045
046  /**
047   * A {@link TypeSet} that is forever empty.
048   *
049   * @nullability This field is never {@code null}.
050   *
051   * @since 0.0.3
052   */
053  public static final TypeSet EMPTY_TYPESET = new TypeSet();
054
055
056  /*
057   * Instance fields.
058   */
059
060
061  private final SortedSet<Type> typeSet;
062
063  private volatile SortedSet<Class<?>> classes;
064
065  private volatile SortedSet<Class<?>> interfaces;
066
067  private volatile SortedSet<Class<?>> rawTypes;
068
069  private volatile Class<?> mostSpecializedInterface;
070
071  private volatile Class<?> mostSpecializedClass;
072
073
074  /*
075   * Constructors.
076   */
077
078
079  /**
080   * Creates a forever-{@linkplain #isEmpty() empty} {@link TypeSet}.
081   *
082   * @see #EMPTY_TYPESET
083   */
084  public TypeSet() {
085    this((Collection<? extends Type>)null);
086  }
087
088  /**
089   * Creates a {@link TypeSet} that {@linkplain #contains(Object)
090   * contains} only the supplied {@link Type} unless the supplied
091   * {@link Type} is {@code null}, in which case the resulting {@link
092   * TypeSet} will be forever {@linkplain #isEmpty() empty}.
093   *
094   * @param type the {@link Type} the new {@link TypeSet} will
095   * contain; may be {@code null} in which case the new {@link
096   * TypeSet} will be {@linkplain #isEmpty() empty}
097   */
098  public TypeSet(final Type type) {
099    this(type == null ? Collections.emptySet() : Collections.singleton(type));
100  }
101
102  /**
103   * Creates a {@link TypeSet} that {@linkplain #contains(Object)
104   * contains} only the {@link Type}s supplied unless the supplied
105   * {@link Collection} is {@code null} or {@linkplain
106   * Collection#isEmpty() empty}, in which case the resulting {@link
107   * TypeSet} will be forever {@linkplain #isEmpty() empty}.
108   *
109   * @param types the {@link Type}s the new {@link TypeSet} will
110   * contain; may be {@code null} or {@linkplain Collection#isEmpty()
111   * empty} in which case the new {@link TypeSet} will be forever
112   * {@linkplain #isEmpty() empty}
113   */
114  public TypeSet(final Collection<? extends Type> types) {
115    super();
116    if (types == null || types.isEmpty()) {
117      this.typeSet = Collections.emptySortedSet();
118    } else {
119      final SortedSet<Type> sortedTypeSet = new TreeSet<>(Types.typeNameComparator);
120      sortedTypeSet.addAll(types);
121      this.typeSet = Collections.unmodifiableSortedSet(sortedTypeSet);
122    }
123  }
124
125
126  /*
127   * Instance methods.
128   */
129
130
131  /**
132   * Returns a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
133   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable} {@link SortedSet}
134   * of all raw types contained directly or indirectly by this {@link
135   * TypeSet}.
136   *
137   * <p>This method calls the {@link #getClasses()} and {@link
138   * #getInterfaces()} methods as part of its operation.</p>
139   *
140   * @return a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
141   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable} {@link SortedSet}
142   * of all raw types contained directly or indirectly by this {@link
143   * TypeSet}
144   *
145   * @see #getClasses()
146   *
147   * @see #getInterfaces()
148   *
149   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
150   *
151   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
152   * threads.
153   *
154   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.  The
155   * {@link Set} that is returned consists of elements in a
156   * particular, but deliberately unspecified, order that is not
157   * dependent upon the ordering of the {@link Set} of {@link Type}s
158   * initially supplied to this {@link TypeSet}.
159   */
160  public final SortedSet<Class<?>> getRawTypes() {
161    SortedSet<Class<?>> rawTypes = this.rawTypes;
162    if (rawTypes == null) {
163      final SortedSet<Class<?>> classes = this.getClasses();
164      final SortedSet<Class<?>> interfaces = this.getInterfaces();
165      if (classes.isEmpty()) {
166        if (interfaces.isEmpty()) {
167          rawTypes = Collections.emptySortedSet();
168        } else {
169          rawTypes = interfaces;
170        }
171      } else if (interfaces.isEmpty()) {
172        rawTypes = classes;
173      } else {
174        final SortedSet<Class<?>> target = new TreeSet<>(Types.typeNameComparator);
175        target.addAll(classes);
176        target.addAll(interfaces);
177        rawTypes = Collections.unmodifiableSortedSet(target);
178      }
179      this.rawTypes = rawTypes;
180    }
181    return rawTypes;
182  }
183
184  /**
185   * Returns a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
186   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable} {@link SortedSet}
187   * of all {@link Class}es (not interfaces) contained directly or
188   * indirectly by this {@link TypeSet}.
189   *
190   * @return a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
191   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable} {@link Set} of all
192   * {@link Class}es (not interfaces) contained directly or indirectly
193   * by this {@link TypeSet}
194   *
195   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
196   *
197   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
198   * threads.
199   *
200   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.  The
201   * {@link Set} that is returned consists of elements in a
202   * particular, but deliberately unspecified, order that is not
203   * dependent upon the ordering of the {@link Set} of {@link Type}s
204   * initially supplied to this {@link TypeSet}.
205   */
206  public final SortedSet<Class<?>> getClasses() {
207    SortedSet<Class<?>> classes = this.classes;
208    if (classes == null) {
209      if (this.isEmpty()) {
210        classes = Collections.emptySortedSet();
211      } else {
212        classes = new TreeSet<>(Types.typeNameComparator);
213        for (final Type type : this) {
214          Class<?> rawType = Types.toClass(type);
215          while (rawType != null) {
216            if (!rawType.isInterface()) {
217              classes.add(rawType);
218            }
219            rawType = rawType.getSuperclass();
220          }
221        }
222        if (classes.isEmpty()) {
223          classes = Collections.emptySortedSet();
224        } else {
225          classes = Collections.unmodifiableSortedSet(classes);
226        }
227      }
228      assert classes != null;
229      this.classes = classes;
230    }
231    return classes;
232  }
233
234  /**
235   * Returns a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
236   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable} {@link Set} of all
237   * interfaces contained directly or indirectly by this {@link
238   * TypeSet}.
239   *
240   * @return a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
241   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable} {@link Set} of all
242   * interfaces contained directly or indirectly by this {@link
243   * TypeSet}
244   *
245   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
246   *
247   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
248   * threads.
249   *
250   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.  The
251   * {@link Set} that is returned consists of elements in a
252   * particular, but deliberately unspecified, order that is not
253   * dependent upon the ordering of the {@link Set} of {@link Type}s
254   * initially supplied to this {@link TypeSet}.
255   */
256  public final SortedSet<Class<?>> getInterfaces() {
257    SortedSet<Class<?>> interfaces = this.interfaces;
258    if (interfaces == null) {
259      if (this.isEmpty()) {
260        interfaces = Collections.emptySortedSet();
261      } else {
262        interfaces = new TreeSet<>(Types.typeNameComparator);
263        for (final Type type : this) {
264          TypeSet.getInterfaces(type, interfaces); // adds to interfaces
265        }
266        if (interfaces.isEmpty()) {
267          interfaces = Collections.emptySortedSet();
268        } else {
269          interfaces = Collections.unmodifiableSortedSet(interfaces);
270        }
271      }
272      this.interfaces = interfaces;
273    }
274    return interfaces;
275  }
276
277  /**
278   * Returns an arbitrarily selected {@link Class} that is guaranteed
279   * to be the most specialized interface in its type hierarchy drawn
280   * from the {@linkplain #getInterfaces() interfaces} in this {@link
281   * TypeSet}, or {@code null} if this {@link TypeSet} contains no
282   * interfaces.
283   *
284   * <p>The {@link Class} that is returned is guaranteed to return
285   * {@code true} from its {@link Class#isInterface()} method.</p>
286   *
287   * <p>For example, if a {@link TypeSet} contains {@link
288   * java.io.Closeable Closeable.class} and {@link AutoCloseable
289   * AutoCloseable.class}, then this method will return {@link
290   * java.io.Closeable Closeable.class}.  If a {@link TypeSet}
291   * contains {@link AutoCloseable AutoCloseable.class} and {@link
292   * java.io.Serializable Serializable.class}, then either {@link
293   * AutoCloseable AutoCloseable.class} or {@link java.io.Serializable
294   * Serializable.class} will be returned.</p>
295   *
296   * @return an arbitrarily selected {@link Class} that is guaranteed
297   * to be the most specialized interface in its type hierarchy drawn
298   * from the {@linkplain #getInterfaces() interfaces} in this {@link
299   * TypeSet}, or {@code null}
300   *
301   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
302   *
303   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
304   *
305   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
306   * threads.
307   *
308   * @see #getMostSpecializedClass()
309   */
310  public final Class<?> getMostSpecializedInterface() {
311    final Class<?> mostSpecializedInterface = this.mostSpecializedInterface;
312    final Class<?> returnValue;
313    if (mostSpecializedInterface == null) {
314      final Set<Class<?>> interfaces = this.getInterfaces();
315      if (interfaces == null || interfaces.isEmpty()) {
316        this.mostSpecializedInterface = Object.class; // marker
317        returnValue = null;
318      } else {
319        final Iterator<? extends Class<?>> interfacesIterator = interfaces.iterator();
320        Class<?> candidate = interfacesIterator.next();
321        while (interfacesIterator.hasNext()) {
322          Class<?> intrface = interfacesIterator.next();
323          if (candidate.isAssignableFrom(intrface)) {
324            candidate = intrface;
325          }
326        }
327        this.mostSpecializedInterface = returnValue = candidate;
328      }
329    } else if (mostSpecializedInterface.equals(Object.class)) {
330      // marker
331      returnValue = null;
332    } else {
333      returnValue = mostSpecializedInterface;
334    }
335    return returnValue;
336  }
337
338  /**
339   * Returns an arbitrarily selected {@link Class} that is guaranteed
340   * to be the most specialized subclass in its type hierarchy drawn
341   * from the {@linkplain #getClasses() classes} in this {@link
342   * TypeSet}.
343   *
344   * <p>For example, if a {@link TypeSet} contains {@link Integer
345   * Integer.class}, {@link Number Number.class} and {@link Object
346   * Object.class}, then this method will return {@link Integer
347   * Integer.class}.  If a {@link TypeSet} contains {@link Integer
348   * Integer.class} and {@link String String.class}, then either
349   * {@link Integer Integer.class} or {@link String String.class} will
350   * be returned.</p>
351   *
352   * <p>In practice, most {@link TypeSet}s in normal use contain
353   * classes from a single inheritance hierarchy.</p>
354   *
355   * @return an arbitrarily selected {@link Class} that is guaranteed
356   * to be the most specialized subclass in its type hierarchy drawn
357   * from the {@linkplain #getClasses() classes} in this {@link
358   * TypeSet}; never {@code null}
359   *
360   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
361   *
362   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
363   *
364   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
365   * threads.
366   *
367   * @see #getMostSpecializedInterface()
368   */
369  public final Class<?> getMostSpecializedClass() {
370    final Class<?> mostSpecializedClass = this.mostSpecializedClass;
371    final Class<?> returnValue;
372    if (mostSpecializedClass == null) {
373      final Set<Class<?>> classes = this.getClasses();
374      if (classes == null || classes.isEmpty()) {
375        this.mostSpecializedClass = returnValue = Object.class;
376      } else {
377        final Iterator<? extends Class<?>> classesIterator = classes.iterator();
378        assert classesIterator.hasNext();
379        Class<?> candidateClass = classesIterator.next();
380        assert candidateClass != null;
381        assert !candidateClass.isInterface();
382        while (classesIterator.hasNext()) {
383          final Class<?> cls = classesIterator.next();
384          assert cls != null;
385          assert !cls.isInterface();
386          if (candidateClass.isAssignableFrom(cls)) {
387            candidateClass = cls;
388          }
389        }
390        this.mostSpecializedClass = returnValue = candidateClass;
391      }
392    } else {
393      returnValue = mostSpecializedClass;
394    }
395    assert returnValue != null;
396    return returnValue;
397  }
398
399  /**
400   * Throws an {@link UnsupportedOperationException} when invoked.
401   *
402   * @param type ignored
403   *
404   * @return Not applicable
405   *
406   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException when invoked
407   */
408  @Override
409  public final boolean add(final Type type) {
410    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
411  }
412
413  /**
414   * Throws an {@link UnsupportedOperationException} when invoked.
415   *
416   * @param types ignored
417   *
418   * @return Not applicable
419   *
420   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException when invoked
421   */
422  @Override
423  public final boolean addAll(final Collection<? extends Type> types) {
424    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
425  }
426
427  /**
428   * Throws an {@link UnsupportedOperationException} when invoked.
429   *
430   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException when invoked
431   */
432  @Override
433  public final void clear() {
434    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
435  }
436
437  @Override
438  public final boolean contains(final Object object) {
439    return !this.isEmpty() && this.typeSet.contains(object);
440  }
441
442  @Override
443  public final boolean containsAll(final Collection<?> objects) {
444    return !this.isEmpty() && this.typeSet.containsAll(objects);
445  }
446
447  @Override
448  public final boolean isEmpty() {
449    return this.typeSet.isEmpty();
450  }
451
452  @Override
453  public final Iterator<Type> iterator() {
454    return this.typeSet.iterator();
455  }
456
457  /**
458   * Throws an {@link UnsupportedOperationException} when invoked.
459   *
460   * @param object ignored
461   *
462   * @return Not applicable
463   *
464   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException when invoked
465   */
466  @Override
467  public boolean remove(final Object object) {
468    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
469  }
470
471  /**
472   * Throws an {@link UnsupportedOperationException} when invoked.
473   *
474   * @param objects ignored
475   *
476   * @return Not applicable
477   *
478   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException when invoked
479   */
480  @Override
481  public boolean removeAll(final Collection<?> objects) {
482    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
483  }
484
485  /**
486   * Throws an {@link UnsupportedOperationException} when invoked.
487   *
488   * @param objects ignored
489   *
490   * @return Not applicable
491   *
492   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException when invoked
493   */
494  @Override
495  public boolean retainAll(final Collection<?> objects) {
496    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
497  }
498
499  @Override
500  public final int size() {
501    return this.typeSet.size();
502  }
503
504  @Override
505  public final Spliterator<Type> spliterator() {
506    return this.typeSet.spliterator();
507  }
508
509  @Override
510  public final Object[] toArray() {
511    return this.typeSet.toArray();
512  }
513
514  @Override
515  public final <T> T[] toArray(final T[] array) {
516    return this.typeSet.toArray(array);
517  }
518
519  @Override
520  public String toString() {
521    return this.typeSet.toString();
522  }
523
524
525  /*
526   * Static methods.
527   */
528
529
530  private static final void getInterfaces(final Type type, final Set<Class<?>> interfaces) {
531    Class<?> cls = Types.toClass(type);
532    if (cls.isInterface()) {
533      interfaces.add(cls);
534    }
535    while (cls != null) {
536      for (final Class<?> intrface : cls.getInterfaces()) {
537        if (interfaces.add(intrface)) {
538          TypeSet.getInterfaces(intrface, interfaces); // XXX recursive
539        }
540      }
541      cls = cls.getSuperclass();
542    }
543  }
544
545}
